text: I Was Made to Love Her is the seventh studio album by American singer- songwriter Stevie Wonder. It was released on August 28th, 1967 under Tamla Records. Wonder also released another album in 1967, a Christmas album called Someday at Christmas. ==Track listing== Side One #"I Was Made to Love Her" (Wonder, Henry Cosby, Sylvia Moy, Lula Mae Hardaway) – 2:36 #"Send Me Some Lovin'" (Lloyd Price, John Marascalo) – 2:29 #"I'd Cry" (Wonder, Moy) – 2:33 #"Everybody Needs Somebody (I Need You)" (Wonder, Clarence Paul) – 2:36 #"Respect" (Otis Redding) – 2:21 #"My Girl" (Smokey Robinson, Ronald White) – 2:55 Side Two #"Baby Don't You Do It" (Holland-Dozier-Holland) – 2:11 #"A Fool for You" (Ray Charles) – 3:16 #"Can I Get a Witness" (Holland-Dozier-Holland) – 2:42 #"I Pity the Fool" (Deadric Malone) – 3:04 #"Please, Please, Please" (James Brown, John Terry) – 2:40 #"Every Time I See You I Go Wild" (Wonder, Cosby, Moy) – 2:52 ==References== Category:1967 albums Category:R&B; albums Category:Soul albums
title: I Was Made to Love Her (album)
